intro: Triodon setaceus, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, spiny leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds covered in a sticky, viscid substance. Triodon setaceus is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
